page.title: 08Working on the Kylesku ferry
page.content: My Grandfather worked on the ferry from 1954 until 1984 when the ferry stopped. As assistant ferryman he worked seven days a week, 12 hours a day in summer. Conditions improved slightly in 1957 when a second assistant ferryman was employed for the summer months only. When the ferry finished, a crew of six was required. During August 1957, 2,536 cars used the ferry, compared with 19,148 cars in August 1973. However by that time, two ferries were in use. With the increase in the price of petrol and charges being introduced, the numbers fell so that in 1982, only 12,188 cars crossed in the same month. Winter was much quieter with very few crossings being made. My Grandfather really enjoyed his work but says,"Thirty years sailing the same waters is enough for anyone."
